description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2f4mp","text":"These are instructions to make highly concentrated (\u003e 1000 ng/µL) Tol2 mRNA. Note, the in-vitro transcription kit (mMESSAGE mMACHINE) is not cheap. 5–6 reactions like the protocol suggests come to ~ 100–120£, so please be thrifty with it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqud","text":"Find the Tol2 plasmid from the Wilson lab freezer. It is #1151 and is labelled Tol2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93der","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d32pp","text":"The concentration (measured on Qubit) is ~ 690 ng/µL (as of the Eppendorf in 2022).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dldu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c8k6","text":"Thaw it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5ivn","text":"We linearise the plasmid using the restriction enzyme NotI HiFi.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e0ik","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8v2q","text":"On ice, prepare 6 reactions in 0.5 mL Eppendorfs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92u1a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nabh","text":"Each reaction is (pipet in this order):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1daf7","text":"Tol2 plasmid 2.9 µL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nvk0","text":"NotI HiFi 2 µL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b89an","text":"CutSmart buffer 10× 10 µL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbrlv","text":"nuclease-free H2O 91.1 µL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59j6k","text":"Total = 100 µL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pdco","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vo16","text":"(Add the enzyme last).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bliqk","text":"Place the Eppendorfs in the 37˚C water bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ilgk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83seo","text":"Incubate for at least 1 hour. Digesting for more than 1 hour may be beneficial (cf. https://international.neb.com/tools-and-resources/usage-guidelines/restriction-endonucleases-survival-in-a-reaction).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":115}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"55C41C5BB84011ED8E3D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://international.neb.com/tools-and-resources/usage-guidelines/restriction-endonucleases-survival-in-a-reaction"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6coea","text":"Clean (remove the enzyme etc.) the reaction using the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit. Similar column-based kits are probably OK.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qpmd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hqr4","text":"Follow the protocol in the box or online.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7id80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vffi","text":"Use a single column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b90nf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0hh","text":"For the first step (adding 5 volumes of PB buffer): transfer each 3 reactions in a 2 mL Eppendorf to obtain two 2 mL Eppendorfs, each containing 300 µL of reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ik29","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuich","text":"Add 1500 µL (5 volumes) of PB buffer. Vortex and spin down (with the benchtop centrifuge).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t3e8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oeqq","text":"Add ~ 700 µL on the column and spin down following the kit's instructions (big centrifuge). Discard flow-through. Repeat until you got all 600 µL of reaction (the two 2 mL Eppendorfs) through the column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ig7n","text":"At the last step of the kit's protocol, elute in 30 µL nuclease-free H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4iq7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13dgp","text":"Measure the concentration on the Qubit (dsDNA BR or HS kit). We expect the concentration to be 200–400 ng/µL *.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfjf6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fi2um","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9gjnv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"abodg","text":"* Logic is: each reaction had ~ 2,000 ng of plasmid (2.9 µL of 690 ng/µL) and we did 6 reactions, so 12,000 ng total. If you lost 0% on the column, you will get 12,000 ng in 30 µL, i.e. 400 ng/µL. If you lost 50% on the column, you will get 6,000 ng in 30 µL, i.e. 200 ng/µL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkjqn","text":"Next step is to turn the linearised Tol2 plasmid (DNA) into mRNA. Find the SP6 mMESSAGE mMACHINE kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1jea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d3gh","text":"! Make sure you are using the SP6 version.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1ulb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c048k","text":"In my experience, each reaction generates 3,000–4,000 ng mRNA. Therefore, to get ~ 12 µL of \u003e 1,000 ng/µL, you will need at least 3 reactions. This is assuming a good output and losing nothing on the column during clean-up, so I try to do 5–6 reactions for critical injections where I need high integration rate directly in F0 injected embryos.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au5sq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rtdo","text":"Prepare each reaction on ice in a small 0.5 mL Eppendorf.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg2d0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b63u","text":"Each reaction is:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rruu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dndb7","text":"2× NTP/CAP 10 µL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61p8o","text":"10× reaction buffer 2 µL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20bd3","text":"linearised Tol2 plasmid ***","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6iqk8","text":"enzyme mix 2 µL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"798gt","text":"nuclease-free H2O *to 20 µL*","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dou5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82ll2","text":"*** Calculate from the concentration found in the previous step so that you use 1 µg.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tt6p","text":"e.g. I found the concentration to be 343 ng/µL, so I use 2.91 µL here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cdqe","text":"Place the Eppendorfs in the 37˚C water bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pj9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b6u4","text":"Incubate for 2 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ccga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djtch","text":"There is no benefit in incubating for more than 2 hours (cf. reaction time course: https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/AM1340#:~:text=mMESSAGE%20mMACHINE%E2%84%A2%20kits%20are,structure%20at%20the%205'%20end.). Should be OK if reaction lasts a bit longer if for whatever reason you cannot stop it in time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":140}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1B22EB8AB84511ED8E3D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/AM1340#:~:text=mMESSAGE%20mMACHINE%E2%84%A2%20kits%20are,structure%20at%20the%205'%20end."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hue2","text":"Add 1 µL TURBO DNase in each reaction (included in the kit). This is removes the DNA, i.e. the linearised plasmid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vaaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc3b2","text":"Incubate in the 37˚C water bath for 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9m756","text":"Clean-up the mRNA using the ZYMO RNA Clean \u0026 Concentrator kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9c0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s3su","text":"Follow the kit's instructions. Use a single column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg90i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"466qq","text":"At the end, elute in 13 µL nuclease-free H2O. Add the 13 µL directly on the column's filter and wait for a few minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr6sh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ptir","text":"Heating the nuclease-free H2O to 70˚C prior to adding it to the water may also help with retrieving as much as possible mRNA from the column, but I have never tried. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egj7c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n3db","text":"(You can always dilute later if you find that the Tol2 mRNA is highly concentrated, so best to elute in a small volume.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v3ge","text":"Measure the concentration on Qubit (BR or HS RNA kit). Qubit can measure low concentrations, so no need to waste precious Tol2 mRNA. You can e.g. dilute 10×:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahf0q","text":"0.4 µL Tol2 mRNA","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d8nc","text":"3.6 µL nuclease-free H2O","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2huen","text":"and measure that concentration. Just remember to multiply the concentration you find by 10.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b0g3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ddjo","text":"You are expecting (hoping) \u003e 1,000 ng/µL. For reference, if each of 6 reactions produced 3000 ng and nothing is lost on the column, you would expect ~ 1384 ng/µL (6 × 3000 ng, eluted in 13 µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vtim","text":"Aliquot the ~ 13 µL in 3–4 small 0.5 mL Eppendorfs and store in the –80˚C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: How to make Tol2 mRNA
